page.title: 07FULFORD PARISH CHURCH
page.content: The parish church is the only one in the Archdeaconry of Stoke-on Trent to be dedicated to St.Nicholas.It is of ancient foundation and from the presence of age old yews in the church yard ,it is believed to occupy the site of a very early Christian place of worship.No date can be given for the first church building but it was well established in the 14th Century as a Chapelry. As a Chapelry it was listed among the churches of Pirehill Hundred and was visited by the commissioners of Edward VI. Soon after the introduction of church ornaments and after the inventory of the second prayer book,the church acquired one silver chalice,one bell and one surplice for the curate.The church stands on elevated ground and has an embattled tower .
